intro: Phacelia viscosa, commonly known as sticky phacelia, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Phacelia viscosa is also valued as a nectar source for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
